text: Mike G.: After high school in the '60s I worked at Swank on,(I believe, Pearl and School Street. When I graduated Swank was the place to work. I remember it well - it was a great family atomophere. With an hour for lunch we would walk to Gus's Grill once a week for lunch. I remember it being the best place to eat. Also, on another day we would go to Bobby's. Tex Barry's is still there (Balfour, of course, is gone). Noon time was also a time for shopping - London's, Silman's, Milady's, Winthrop's and the Camera Shop. When I first started work in Attleboro there was even a Woolworth's and not so many banks. Now there is one on every corner. Mr. Howard: Whew! I dare not comment. Everyone, have a wonderful day.
